definition: to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to remain calm in the face of adversity (idiom)

sentences.english: Life is a long journey, challenges keep pace with opportunites during this journey.
sentences.chinese: 生命是一場短途遊覽，在旅途上有應戰和機緣。

sentences.english: Be thankful for each new challenge, because it will build your strength and character.
sentences.chinese: 感激每一次新的應戰，由於它會塑造你的個性和力量。

sentences.english: The school challenged us to a game of football.
sentences.chinese: 那所黌舍向本人們應戰賽場足球。

sentences.english: But did pull out the sword yingzhen jie, but was soon down.
sentences.chinese: 胤傑無奈拔劍應戰，但很快就被打倒。

sentences.english: We met an enemy attack calmly under the direction of the general.
sentences.chinese: 我們在將軍的指揮下沉着應戰。

sentences.english: Forty-five minutes is a long, long time to play with ten men.
sentences.chinese: 對10人應戰來說四十五分鐘是很久的。

sentences.english: The Wuchang let the fortune teller to write with notices.
sentences.chinese: 那五常讓算命先生代寫應戰告示。

sentences.english: Or can these two hotties work it out?
sentences.chinese: 還有這兩位美能否從容應戰？

sentences.english: It buckled like a graham cracker.
sentences.chinese: 這就像一個全麥餅乾沉着應戰。

sentences.english: In order to hold the north and zheng, JiXin bear the tone this action.
sentences.chinese: 爲了和鄭北執這口吻，齊欣承受了這個應戰。

sentences.english: The next day, the physical team intense battle.
sentences.chinese: 第二天白天，方天翼的隊伍緊張的應戰。

sentences.english: And he came out with three thousand footmen, and four hundred horsemen.
sentences.chinese: 哥爾基雅率領三千步兵，四百騎兵出來應戰。

sentences.english: This represents a serious challenge to condiments marketers.
sentences.chinese: 這表現了嚴重應戰調味操行銷。

definition: to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
